definition: theatrical work (play, opera, TV series etc)/dramatic (change, increase etc)/acute/severe

sentences.english: Per capita incomes rose sharply last year.
The sales growth has sparked an investment surge in genomics startups.
sentences.chinese: 销售增长已引发了投资基因技术新创公司的资金剧增。

sentences.english: The intemperate life style is the patient population sharp increase primary factor.
sentences.chinese: 无节制的生活方式是患者人数剧增的主要因素。

sentences.english: Will the Internet usher in a new economic growth explosion?
sentences.chinese: 因特网是否能引发新一轮的经济剧增呢？

sentences.english: The cause for contracepting offspring is the “population explosion”.
sentences.chinese: 避孕的原因是“人口剧增”。

sentences.english: There has been a leap in the number of births in Britain.
sentences.chinese: 英国的出生人数出现了剧增。

sentences.english: The battle to catch Google grows harder by the day.
sentences.chinese: 赶超谷歌的战役难度与日剧增。

sentences.english: And China subsidized a huge increase of solar equipment production, producing a surplus.
sentences.chinese: 中国对剧增的太阳能设备生产的补贴，导致生产过剩。

sentences.english: With the mobile phone industry development, China's mobile phone users surge.
sentences.chinese: 随着移动通信产业的发展，中国手机用户剧增。

sentences.english: Objective To investigate the effects of high superior vein cave pressure(SCVP)on brain injury on young dog.
sentences.chinese: 目的探讨上腔静脉压剧增对幼犬脑损伤的影响。

sentences.english: South Georgia's king penguin populations too are soaring.
sentences.chinese: 南乔治亚的王企鹅数量也剧增。

definition: to increase steadily/to grow with each passing day
year after year/with each passing year/over the years
to intensify/to sharpen/to accelerate/to aggravate/to exacerbate/to embitter
to double/to redouble/to increase many times over/to multiply by a factor/multiplication
(increasing) day by day/(more critical) with every passing day/gradually
day by day/more and more/increasingly/more and more with each passing day
to clamber up/(of prices etc) to rise
